main.name: Prabhsimran Singh
main.description: currently employed by Savoir-faire Linux, Montreal, where I work as a Java Backend Developer along with wide array of technologies.
main.bio: I will describe myself as a Learner with an immense passion to create out of the box applications. As a Developer at Savoir-faire Linux, I have gained a lot of experience in every aspect of SDLC process. I have been learning and doing everything from client interactions to deployments in a complete Agile way. With my experience here, I also had to chance to work with AWS services particularly S3, Lambda, API Gateway, Cognito, IAM. As a Consultant, you have to be dynamic, ready to face any challenge, learn any technology while enjoying everything in this process. I am looking myself as a Full Stack Cloud engineer with my favorite stack as Spring Boot, ReactJs and AWS Cloud Services.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Studying at Concordia was the best part of my education as it was here, where I achieved a much more thorough education in the underlying theory, concepts, and science behind more complex programming. Pursuing master's paved the way for new beginnings. The most important thing that I developed in myself is to let go of the fear of programming as I had come from Electronics Background. I got to work with Java, Python, Clojure, Erlang, Databases, UML, SRS, Parallel Programming in Java and found that I have a knack for understanding complex algorithms..

education.degree: Bachelors in Electronics and Communications Engineering
education.description: I started my degree in Electronics and Communication Engineering back in India where I gained handful of knowledge in Microcontrollers, Integrated Circuits, Communication and Fiber Optics. I also got my first experience with Information Technology by doing Programming concepts in C and Software Processes. Fortunately, I was placed in TCS in the beginning of my final year. And I decided to grow more in this field so I got a Junior Java Developer Internship in my Last Semester. This was the beginning of my Journey towards Software Engineering and I decided to pursue Masters in this field.

work.title: Open Source Consultant
work.description: I started working here building an Intranet Solution for one of our Clients on Liferay which is a Java based CMS. Here I have had the chance to get my hands dirty with all parts of our software solution. I have worked mainly with Java, JQuery, JavaScript, Git, Maven and Linux OS. Heavily used ​ Microsoft Graph API​ to implement and integrate ​ O365​ features into the Intranet. Authenticated and authorized seamless integration of users from Microsoft ​ Azure​ Active Directory into Liferay. Also, I used to deploy application in CI/CD environment using Git, GitLab, and Jenkins Pipeline and communicated with clients, co-workers about current tasks and followed procedures and mechanisms to ensure compliance to technical designs and best practices. I also worked on my company's corporate website which is built on top of Python's Django Framework. Recenlty, I have also gained experience with ELK stack which is highly optimized SQL database and I did a thorough POC on implementing it within the company. I move forward to take this immense experience gained to build useful applications in future.

projects.title: Virtual Wallet
projects.category: A Rest-API based service for managing transactions.

projects.title: Todo Application
projects.category: A todo management web app built on top of React and Spring boot

projects.title: Resume Website
projects.category: A React based resume website template

testimonials.text: Prabh is a very talented individual. I met him at the university and I can say he is very dedicated and passionate about the things he do. The way he has took initiatives and managed various projects showed his great team-work skills. I am sure he will be a valuable asset for any organisation.
testimonials.user: Mohit Dhiman, M.Eng Software Engineering, Concordia University
